title: I05-5004

sentences.text: Towards deep analysis of compositional classes of paraphrases , we have examined a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples , in which sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement .
Our preliminary experiments on building a paraphrase corpus have so far been producing promising results , which we have evaluated according to cost-efficiency , exhaustiveness , and reliability .

Entity-class-oriented_framework.label: class-oriented framework
Entity-class-oriented_framework.description: The 'class-oriented framework' refers to a systematic approach for collecting paraphrase examples by categorizing sentential paraphrases into distinct classes, utilizing both automatic candidate generation and manual judgment to enhance the analysis of compositional classes of paraphrases.

Entity-compositional_class_of_paraphrase.label: compositional classes of paraphrases
Entity-compositional_class_of_paraphrase.description: Compositional classes of paraphrases refer to distinct categories of paraphrases that are analyzed and collected using a framework that organizes sentential paraphrases based on their structural and semantic characteristics.

Entity-our_preliminary_experiment.label: Our preliminary experiments
Entity-our_preliminary_experiment.description: Our preliminary experiments refer to the initial investigations conducted to build a paraphrase corpus, which have yielded promising results evaluated based on cost-efficiency, exhaustiveness, and reliability.

Entity-paraphrase_corpus.label: paraphrase corpus
Entity-paraphrase_corpus.description: A paraphrase corpus is a collection of text pairs that express the same meaning in different wording, used for training and evaluating natural language processing models.

Entity-sentential_paraphrase.label: sentential paraphrases
Entity-sentential_paraphrase.description: Sentential paraphrases are linguistic constructs that express the same meaning as a given sentence while differing in their wording or structure.

Entity-promising_result.label: promising results
Entity-promising_result.description: The term 'promising results' refers to the positive outcomes observed from preliminary experiments conducted in the development of a paraphrase corpus, evaluated based on criteria such as cost-efficiency, exhaustiveness, and reliability.

Entity-paraphrase_example.label: paraphrase examples
Entity-paraphrase_example.description: Paraphrase examples are instances of sentences that convey the same meaning using different wording, often used to illustrate variations in expression within a specific paraphrase class.

Entity-automatic_candidate_generation.label: automatic candidate generation
Entity-automatic_candidate_generation.description: Automatic candidate generation is a process or algorithm used to systematically produce potential examples or instances, often for the purpose of further evaluation or selection in tasks such as natural language processing.

Entity-reliability.label: reliability
Entity-reliability.description: In the context of evaluating the effectiveness of a paraphrase corpus, 'reliability' refers to a quality measure that assesses the consistency and dependability of the results obtained from the experiments.

Entity-exhaustiveness.label: exhaustiveness
Entity-exhaustiveness.description: Exhaustiveness refers to an evaluation metric used to assess the completeness and thoroughness of the paraphrase corpus in the context of the study.

Entity-preliminary_experiment.label: preliminary experiments
Entity-preliminary_experiment.description: Preliminary experiments refer to initial trials or tests conducted to gather data and assess the feasibility or effectiveness of a research method before more extensive studies are undertaken.

Entity-manual_judgement.label: manual judgement
Entity-manual_judgement.description: Manual judgement refers to the process of evaluating or assessing something based on human decision-making rather than automated methods.

Entity-result.label: results
Entity-result.description: Results refer to the outcomes or findings obtained from experiments or analyses.

Entity-cost-efficiency.label: cost-efficiency
Entity-cost-efficiency.description: Cost-efficiency refers to the effectiveness of a process or system in achieving desired outcomes relative to the costs incurred, often used as a metric to evaluate economic performance.

summary: Towards deep analysis of compositional classes of paraphrases , we have examined a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples , in which sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement . Our preliminary experiments on building a paraphrase corpus have so far been producing promising results , which we have evaluated according to cost-efficiency , exhaustiveness , and reliability .

Predicate-are_collected_for.label: are collected for
Predicate-are_collected_for.description: The predicate 'are collected for' indicates a relationship where the subject is gathered or assembled with the purpose of serving or contributing to the object. It implies that the items represented by the subject are systematically accumulated to fulfill a specific need, function, or classification represented by the object.

Predicate-is_for_collecting.label: is for collecting
Predicate-is_for_collecting.description: The predicate 'is for collecting' indicates that the subject serves a purpose or function related to the gathering or accumulation of the object. It implies that the subject is designed, intended, or utilized to aggregate, compile, or assemble instances of the object, which in this context refers to a specific type of data, information, or examples.

Predicate-producing.label: producing
Predicate-producing.description: The predicate 'producing' indicates an active process in which the subject generates, creates, or yields the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is the source or initiator of the action, and the object represents the outcome or result of that action. In this context, 'producing' conveys a sense of transformation or development from the subject to the object, highlighting the effectiveness or success of the subject's efforts.

Predicate-evaluated_according_to.label: evaluated according to
Predicate-evaluated_according_to.description: The predicate 'evaluated according to' establishes a relationship where the subject is assessed or judged based on the criteria or standard specified by the object. It indicates that the evaluation process involves measuring the subject against the parameters defined by the object, thereby providing a framework for understanding the subject's value, effectiveness, or performance in relation to the specified criteria.

Predicate-have_produced.label: have produced
Predicate-have_produced.description: The predicate 'have produced' indicates a causal or generative relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject has actively created, generated, or resulted in the object. It implies that the actions or processes associated with the subject have led to the emergence or availability of the object, often suggesting a positive or successful outcome.

Predicate-have_evaluated.label: have evaluated
Predicate-have_evaluated.description: The predicate 'have evaluated' indicates that the subject has conducted an assessment or analysis of the object, which represents a specific aspect, characteristic, or performance measure. This connection implies that the subject has gathered data or insights regarding the object, leading to a conclusion or judgment about its value, effectiveness, or quality.

Predicate-have_been_built_by.label: have been built by
Predicate-have_been_built_by.description: The predicate 'have been built by' indicates a relationship where the subject has been created, constructed, or developed as a result of the actions or contributions of the object. It emphasizes the role of the object as the source or agent responsible for the formation or establishment of the subject.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider scope or range of concepts, of which the subject is a part.
